Jargon Term: You should take your pain medication as directed to stay ahead of the pain otherwise you won't be able to take deep breaths
Annotation: Aftercare instructions - patient needs to do - Medication

Jargon Term: If the pain medication is too sedating take half the dose and notify your physician
Annotation: Aftercare instructions - patient needs to do - Medication

Jargon Term: use your incentive spirometer 4 times every hour while awake
Annotation: Aftercare instructions - patient needs to do - Medication

Jargon Term: You will be more comfortable if you use a cough pillow to hold against your chest and guard your rib cage while coughing and deep breathing
Annotation: Aftercare instructions - patient needs to do - Other

Jargon Term: Symptomatic relief with ice packs or heating pads for short periods may ease the pain
Annotation: Aftercare instructions - patient needs to do - Other

Jargon Term: Narcotic pain medication can cause constipation therefore you should take a stool softener twice daily and increase your fluid and fiber intake if possible
Annotation: Aftercare instructions - patient needs to do - Diet
Aftercare instructions - patient needs to do - Other

Jargon Term: You can put your left arm in a sling for comfort
Annotation: Aftercare instructions - patient needs to do - Other

Jargon Term: No heavy lifting or any type of contact sports for 6-8 weeks so as not to reinjue your spleen
Annotation: Aftercare instructions - patient needs to do - Other

Jargon Term: If you develop any dizziness, feel faint or have any more blood in your urine please call your doctor or return to the Emergency Room
Annotation: Aftercare instructions - patient needs to do - Other

Jargon Term: Return to the Emergency Room right away for any acute shortness of breath, increased pain or crackling sensation around your ribs
Annotation: Aftercare instructions - patient needs to do - Other
